exposurebracketing: 2-3 frames in steps of 1/3, 1/2, 2/3, 1, 2, or 3 EV
exposurecompensation: Can be adjusted by -5 - +5 EV in increments of 1/3 or 1/2 EV in P, S, A, and M modes
speed: 1/4000 - 30 s in steps of 1/3 or 1/2 EV, bulb, time (requires optional ML-L3 remote control), X200
monitor: 8-cm/3.2-in., approx. 921k-dot (VGA),  low-temperature polysilicon TFT LCD with approx. 170 °; viewing angle,  approx. 100% frame coverage, and automatic monitor brightness control  using ambient brightness sensor
accessoryterminal: Remote cord: MC-DC2 (available separately). GPS unit: GP-1/GP-1A (available separately)
focuslock: Focus can be locked by pressing shutter-release button halfway (single-servo AF) or by pressing AE-L/AF-L button
adlbracketing: 2 frames using selected value for one frame or 3 frames using preset values for all frames
flashcontrol: TTL: i-TTL flash control using  2,016-pixel RGB sensor is available with built-in flash and SB-910,  SB-900, SB-800, SB-700, SB-600, SB-400, or SB-300; i-TTL balanced  fill-flash for digital SLR is used with matrix and center-weighted  metering, standard i-TTL flash for digital SLR with spot metering
flashreadyindicator: Lights when built-in flash or optional flash unit is fully charged; flashes after flash is fired at full output
compatiblelenses: Compatible with AF NIKKOR  lenses, including type G, E, and D lenses (some restrictions apply to PC  lenses) and DX lenses (using DX 24 x 16 1.5x image area), AI-P NIKKOR  lenses, and non-CPU AI lenses (A and M modes only). IX NIKKOR lenses,  lenses for the F3AF, and non-AI lenses can not be used. The electronic  rangefinder can be used with lenses that have a maximum aperture of f/8  or faster (the electronic rangefinder supports the center 7 focus points  with lenses that have a maximum aperture of f/8 or faster and the  center 33 focus points with lenses that have a maximum aperture of f/6.8  or faster).
mode: Auto (auto; auto (flash off)); scene  (portrait; landscape; child; sports; close up; night portrait; night  landscape; party/indoor; beach/snow; sunset; dusk/dawn; pet portrait;  candlelight; blossom; autumn colors; food; silhouette; high key; low  key); programmed auto with flexible program (P); shutter-priority auto  (S); aperture-priority auto (A); manual (M); U1 (user settings 1); U2  (user settings 2)
exposurelock: Luminosity locked at detected value with AE-L/AF-L button
audioinput: Stereo mini-pin jack (3.5 mm diameter; plug-in power supported)
accessoryshoe: ISO 518 hot-shoe with sync and data contacts and safety lock
weight: Approx. 850 g (1 lb 14.0 oz) with battery and memory card but without body cap; approx. 760 g (1 lb 10.8 oz; camera body only)
flashmode: Auto, auto with red-eye reduction,  auto slow sync, auto slow sync with red-eye reduction, fill-flash,  red-eye reduction, slow sync, slow sync with red-eye reduction,  rear-curtain with slow sync, rear-curtain sync, off; Auto FP High-Speed  Sync supported
meteringmode: TTL exposure metering using 2,016-pixel RGB sensor
suppliedaccessories: BS-1 accessory shoe cover,  DK-21 rubber eyecup, BM-14 monitor cover, BF-1B body cap, EN-EL15  rechargeable Li-ion battery (with terminal cover), MH-25 battery  charger, DK-5 eyepiece cap, AN-DC10 strap, UC-E15 USB cable, ViewNX 2 CD
batterypack: Optional MB-D14 multi-power  battery pack with one rechargeable Nikon EN-EL15 Li-ion battery or six  AA alkaline, Ni-MH, or lithium batteries
isosensitivityrecommendedexposureindex: ISO  100-6400 in steps of 1/3 or 1/2 EV. Can also be set to approx. 0.3,  0.5, 0.7, or 1 EV (ISO 50 equivalent) below ISO 100 or to approx. 0.3,  0.5, 0.7, 1, or 2 EV (ISO 25600 equivalent) above ISO 6400; auto ISO  sensitivity control available
selftimer: 2 s, 5 s, 10 s, 20 s; 1-9 exposures at intervals of 0.5, 1, 2, or 3 s
doubleslot: Slot 2 can be used for overflow or  backup storage or for separate storage of copies created using NEF+JPEG;  pictures can be copied between cards.
lensmount: Nikon F mount (with AF coupling and AF contacts)
flashbracketing: 2-3 frames in steps of 1/3, 1/2, 2/3, 1, 2, or 3 EV
thed610offersaneffectivepixelcountof243m: Key Features• 24.3  megapixel FX-format CMOS sensor• EXPEED 3 image processing• Enhanced continuous shooting (NEW)• Improved Auto white balance• 39 focus points (9 cross-type), up to f/8 compatible• Compact, light, durable• 100% glass-pentaprism viewfinder• Broadcast-quality video
builtinflash: Auto, portrait, child, close up,  night portrait, party/indoor, pet portrait: Auto flash with auto pop-up  P, S, A, M, food: Manual pop-up with button release
metering: TTL exposure metering using main image sensor
depthoffieldpreview: Pressing depth-of-field  preview button stops lens aperture down to value selected by user (A and  M modes) or by camera (other modes)
afareamode: Face-priority AF, wide-area AF, normal-area AF, subject-tracking AF
magnification: Approx. 0.7 x (50 mm f/1.4 lens at infinity, -1.0 m-1)
dustreductionsystem: Image sensor cleaning, Image Dust Off reference data (optional Capture NX 2 software required)
releasemode: Single frame, continuous low  speed, continuous high speed, quiet shutter-release, quiet continuous  shutter-release, self-timer, Remote control, mirror-up
remotereleasemodes: Delayed remote, quick-response remote, remote mirror-up
focusingscreen: Type B BriteView Clear Matte Mark VIII screen with AF area brackets (framing grid can be displayed)
supportedlanguages: Arabic, Chinese (Simplified  and Traditional), Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French,  German, Greek, Hindi, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean,  Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese (Portugal and Brazil), Romanian, Russian,  Spanish, Swedish, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian
framesizepixelsandframerate: 1,920 x  1,080; 30 p (progressive), 25 p, 24 p. 1,280 x 720; 60 p, 50 p, 30 p, 25  p. Actual frame rates for 60 p, 50 p, 30 p, 25 p, and 24 p are 59.94,  50, 29.97, 25, and 23.976 fps respectively; options support both high  and normal image quality
freegripoffer: Purchase a Nikon D610 body or kit and claim a Free MB-D14 Battery Grip from Nikon UK.To claim your free grip click here
flashsyncspeed: X=1/200 s; synchronizes with shutter at 1/250 s or slower (flash range drops at speeds between 1/200 and 1/250 s)
frameadvancerate: 1-5 fps (continuous low speed), 6 fps (continuous high speed), or 3 fps (quiet continuous shutter-release)
nikoncreativelightingsystemcls: Advanced  Wireless Lighting supported with built-in flash, SB-910, SB-900, SB-800,  or SB-700 as a master flash and SB-600 or SB-R200 as remotes, or SU-800  as commander; built-in flash can serve as master flash in commander  mode; Auto FP High-Speed Sync and modeling illumination supported with  all CLS-compatible flash units except SB-400 and SB-300; Flash Color  Information Communication and FV lock supported with all CLS-compatible  flash units
media: SD (Secure Digital) and UHS-I compliant SDHC and SDXC memory cards
playback: Full-frame and thumbnail (4, 9, or 72  images or calendar) playback with playback zoom, movie playback, photo  and/or movie slide shows, histogram display, highlights, photo  information, GPS data display, and auto image rotation
dimensionswxhxd: Approx. 141 x 113 x 82 mm (5.6 x 4.4 x 3.2 in.)
autofocus: Contrast-detect AF anywhere in frame  (camera selects focus point automatically when face-priority AF or  subject-tracking AF is selected)
lensservo: Autofocus (AF): Single-servo AF (AF-S); full-time servo AF (AF-F). Manual focus (M)
focuspoint: Can be selected from 39 or 11 focus points
flashcompensation: -3 - +1 EV in increments of 1/3 or 1/2 EV
picturecontrolsystem: Standard, Neutral,  Vivid, Monochrome, Portrait, Landscape; selected Picture Control can be  modified; storage for custom Picture Controls
imagesizepixels: FX (36x24) image area 6,016  x 4,016 (L), 4,512 x 3,008 (M), 3,008 x 2,008 (S). DX (24x16) image  area 3,936 x 2,624 (L), 2,944 x 1,968 (M), 1,968 x 1,312 (S). FX-format  photographs taken in movie live view 6,016 x 3,376 (L), 4,512 x 2,528  (M), 3,008 x 1,688 (S). DX-format photographs in movie live view 3,936 x  2,224 (L), 2,944 x 1,664 (M), 1,968 x 1,112 (S)
activedlighting: Auto, Extra high, High, Normal, Low, Off
eyepoint: 21 mm (-1.0 m-1; from center surface of viewfinder eyepiece lens)
acadapter: EH-5b AC adapter; requires EP-5B power connector (available separately)
modes: Live view photography (still images), movie live view (movies)
rangeiso100f14lens20c68f: Matrix or center-weighted metering: 0-20 EV. Spot metering: 2-20 EV
filesystem: DCF (Design Rule for Camera File  System) 2.0, DPOF (Digital Print Order Format), Exif (Exchangeable Image  File Format for Digital Still Cameras) 2.3, PictBridge
audiorecordingdevice: Built-in monaural or external stereo microphone; sensitivity adjustable
framecoverage: FX (36x24): Approx. 100% horizontal and 100% vertical. DX (24x16): Approx. 97% horizontal and 97% vertical
whitebalance: Auto (2 types), incandescent,  fluorescent (7 types), direct sunlight, flash, cloudy, shade, preset  manual (up to 4 values can be stored), choose color temperature (2500 K -  10000 K), all with fine-tuning
